Posts.EditableText:
Hi,

I'm new to the Quest-Developer Software and to the forum. I spend a few hours with the program and it's fantastic and easy to use.
Here is my problem:
I want to write a Gamebook i want to use on my Kindle with the Gargoyle-Player via KUAL launcher:
[url:2ghlk18r]http://www.fabiszewski.net/kindle-gargoyle/[/url:2ghlk18r]
Gargoyle-Player supports Quest-formats .asl and .cad. I suppose these are older formats of Quest Vers. 4.x or older.
Am i right? Is there any chance i can download an older Version of Quest that supports the .asl format?

Great thanks for your time and for this gorgeous program!

Zet
Posts.HTML:

http://www.fabiszewski.net/kindle-gargoyle/
Gargoyle-Player supports Quest-formats .asl and .cad. I suppose these are older formats of Quest Vers. 4.x or older.

Posts.EditableText: The .asl and .cas formats are created by Quest 4 and earlier versions. You can download Quest 4.1.5 at http://textadventures.co.uk/quest/desktop - click the "Previous Versions" button. I'm not sure if Gargoyle will support even Quest 4 though - if it's using Geas I think that's from around the time of Quest 3, and even then I don't think it was 100% compatible. If you really must use Gargoyle you'll probably have a much better time using something like Inform, to be honest.
Posts.HTML:
The .asl and .cas formats are created by Quest 4 and earlier versions. You can download Quest 4.1.5 at http://textadventures.co.uk/quest/desktop - click the "Previous Versions" button.

I'm not sure if Gargoyle will support even Quest 4 though - if it's using Geas I think that's from around the time of Quest 3, and even then I don't think it was 100% compatible.

If you really must use Gargoyle you'll probably have a much better time using something like Inform, to be honest.
